snippet: Lawmakers hoping to turn Eric Cantor’s defeat to their advantage have only until next week to marshal their allies.
abstract: Rep Eric Cantor of Virginia resigns as House majority leader, hoping to smooth transition following stunning primary loss; move sets off internal battle to remake the upper ranks of House leadership that is likely to push an already conservative leadership further to the right.

byline.contributor: Carl Hulse, Emmarie Huetteman and Jeremy W. Peters contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Lawmakers hoping to turn Eric Cantor’s defeat to their advantage have only until next week to marshal their allies.

headline.sub: House Leadership Shake-Up Sets Off Scramble in G.O.P.
headline.main: Cantor Resigns Leadership Post in Effort to Smooth House Transition
headline.print_headline: Cantor Resigns Leadership Post in Effort to Smooth House Transition
